TopicTitle: Game occasionally crashes and corrupts file I was playing on

Articles.Content:
Hi guys. Sorry if this has already been posted and answered a million times, but I'd like to know how to stop it from happening.

My game has crashed a few times during gameplay (building, crashing stuff, etc.) and when I launch it, it won't let me click the 'load' button until I fix it. If I just move the file that got corrupted (the one I was playing when the game crashed) to a separate folder, it solves the problem however this means I lose my builds. While I haven't lost anything I'm really attached to yet I'm pretty terrified that's eventually going to happen. Is there any way to stop this or fix corrupted saves?
Are you using any mods, as they can often be the source of problems? Also, if you are running the 64 bit version, I believe that has stability problems.

Well, it really depends a lot on what you are doing. It would be helpful to us if you could visit this thread and provide a few more details: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92230-%21%21%21-PLEASE-READ-BEFORE-POSTING-%21%21%21-Stock-Support-Bug-Reporting-Guide

Welcome to the forums!

Cheers,

~Claw
it happened to me a few times in the past (not recently). I learned to occasionally make a back up of the saved game by creating a copy of the save folder in the KSP directory.

Option #1 - Install a mod that makes backups of your KSP .sfs save file. (Either Kerbal Alarm Clock and/or S.A.V.E. mod)

Option #2 - On Win7 or later, it should be creating System Restore Points daily, as a side-effect you can use the Previous Versions tab of the save file to restore a know good copy of your save file.

Option #3 - Use some sort of version control system on your KSP save folder. Or a versioned backup system.
